title: PM exaggerates economic crisis: AKD
body_lines: Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe was exaggerating the economic crisis for his own political agenda, which had aggravated the crisis, JVP Leader Anura Kumara Dissanayake said today.

He told a news conference that the Prime Minister has been a spokesman who was exaggerating the economic crisis to cover up his failures and said he was exaggerating the situation to convince that the crisis was managed at least this level due to his success.

"The Prime Minister bloats up the economic crisis. He said recently that fuel was only sufficient for one day. As a result, people lined up in queques more than the other days. He also said the government will have to print Rs. Three trillions of money. People who have knowledged in economic affairs are withdrawing money deposited in banks. It has aggravated the crisis.
He also said food is only sufficient for one week and people have to manage with only two meals a day. People started to stock food aggravated the scarcity.

The Prime Minister is trying to convince by exaggerating crisis which is being managed at this level due to his presence,' he said and added that this exaggeration of the situation has aggravated the crisis. (Ajith Siriwardana)
